data.title: Capabilities
data.meta_description: Interdisciplinary Research Institutes The Huck Institutes of the Life Sciences More Information   The Huck Institutes were established in 1996 to enhance and facilitate excellence in interdisciplinary research and training in the life sciences across Penn State. We accomplish this by investing strategically in the recruitment of outstanding faculty who then build and retain
data.text:
Photo of Shared Fermentation Facility lab.

Penn State's interdisciplinary research institutes, listed below, operate a portfolio of world-class research instrumentation, services and consulting that are available to internal and external users.

List of laboratories with shared core facilities

Search for shared instruments and services

In addition to browsing the interdisciplinary research institutes below, internal and external users can search the facilities and research instrumentation available for use at pure.psu.edu*.

Search tips:

For most inclusive search results, search by free text, and use both types of instruments and methodologies. For example, search both "microscope" and "microscopy," or "mass spectrometer" and "mass spectrometry."

*This database of core facilties is in development, with the majority of shared facilities entered as of 9/1/2018. Completion is expected in the summer of 2018. If you have a new shared research facility (with approved external rates) and would like to include the instrument or service in the database, please email osvpr@psu.edu.

Innovation Gateway is designed to connect Penn State researchers to the technical challenges and needs of industry. This framework was created by Penn State and has resulted in efficient and successful research partnerships across the University. Industry partners are able to capture a variety of proposals from world-class experts, and researchers are able to quickly translate their work from idea to impact.

Click here for an overview of Innovation Gateway process (PDF) for researchers and companies. Penn State researchers may view current opportunities at innovation.psu.edu.

Penn State's more than 700 industrial research partnerships are supported by a streamlined intellecutal property (IP) policy. To learn more about IP at Penn State, contact the Office of Industrial Partnerships at researchpartnerships.psu.edu.

Photo: Barbara Hackman Franklin Atrium, Pattee Library. Image: Wilson Hutton

The Association of Research Libraries (ARL) Library Investment Index listed the Penn State University Libraries among the top 10 in North America, and second among U.S. public university research libraries. The index provides a yearly snapshot of the size of each research library's collections and its capacity to provide services to students, faculty and staff, as well as to visiting researchers. The University Libraries consistently rank among the top 10 among more than 110 peer institutionsâ€™ libraries surveyed.
